intro: Ctenitis paranaensis, commonly known as the Parana fern, is a species of tree fern native to South America. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and a crown of feathery fronds. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in tropical and subtropical forests. Its fronds are bi-directionally pinnate, with a distinctive, finely divided structure. Ctenitis paranaensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
